result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clinton A Wilson

records.addlTxt: to appear and act - Atty Erika Bierma (the Court requires approval for any nonappearance by defn)
ADA Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State. Attorney Erika L. Bierma appeared in person with Defn. STC scheduled, NIH.
Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 09:45 am.
DCPS Violation Report; the Court requests no change but monitor in response to report

The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services immediately after his hearing on 7/21/22. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Amy S. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 2700 block of Kendall Ave or the four block radius around the 2700 block of Kendall Ave as follows: Chamberlain Avenue from N. Franklin Avenue to Grand Avenue, Stevens Street from N. Franklin Avenue to Grand Avenue, N. Franklin Avenue from Chamberlain Avenue to Stevens Street, Grand Avenue from Chamberlain Avenue to Stevens Street.
- Defendant shall be accompanied by one Keep the Peace officer to allow him to get his personal belongings from 314 Farley Ave.
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services

01:32 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Erika L Bierma.  ADA Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim A.S. appearing via telephone.  
Statement by A.S. Court and parties discuss history and status. 
Additions to Conditions
- Defendant cannot be in the 2700 block of Kendall Ave. or the 4 block radius around 2700 Kendall Ave as follows: 
    Chamberlain Ave from N. Franklin Ave. to Grand Ave.
    Stevens St from N. Franklin Ave. to Grand Ave.
    N. Franklin Ave. from Chamberlain Ave. to Stevens St.
    Grand Ave. from Chamberlain Ave. to Stevens St.
- Defendant will have 1 Keep the Piece to allow him to get his personal belongings from his mother's home at 314 Farley Ave.

All other conditions remain the same
Bail/bond hearing on July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
for leave to file additional motions - defn
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Pre-trial conference on August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Amy S. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 2 

Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

08:31 AM Attorney Erika L Bierma in court on behalf of defendant.  Frank John Remington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
